name: Holiday Inn Chester South

reviews.text: Overall this holiday inn is fine, but why there is no lift is very strange in a 3/4 star property. Although I realised this prior to making a reservation, it is not stated on the hotel's own website, only on third party websites. There are only 2 floors, but it is struggle with a pram and I am not sure how wheelchair users would cope if assigned a room on the first floor.
reviews.title: Why is there no lift?

reviews.text: Anyway, the hotel itself is as previously described - 70s/80s exterior with a fresh new reception/lobby area. The internal corridors seem to go on for a long time with plenty of twists and turns before finding your room.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are good, standard holiday inn decor and good sized bathrooms although looking slightly dated now.
reviews.title: Fine but the service seriously needs working on.

reviews.text: The pool area was good - a nice hot tub in a conservatory extension of the pool if you like and a sauna in the changing rooms. I could not see a steam room though. The gym looked OK, but did not have to use it.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On checking in we were offered special vouchers for breakfast at £10 each as opposed to the regular c£14 price. We took up this offer as there are no eateries located in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. On a Sunday morning the restaurant was busy with small queues forming, but nothing too serious. The curse of the Satrurday night wedding party was avioded as those guests were shown to a separate dining room.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!! Take your own drinks!!

reviews.title: Excellent for Chester City visitor

reviews.text: Hotel easy to find just off main road links.
reviews.title: Good value, clean hotel.

reviews.text: Caught no. 1 Wrexham bus back pick up outside M&sS Store cost £2.50 return per person bus goes every 15 mins both ways) Believe parking is £7.50, but we liked the freedom of just getting to the city with out fussing over where to park. Pick up bus time table at visitors centre.

reviews.text: Hotel- This hotel does not have a lift but to be fair it is mentioned.
reviews.title: Rip Off!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel with my husband for our first wedding anniversary, for two nights Tues-Thurs, £139 for B&B. The hotel was very easy to find and there is plenty of free parking. On arrival we were slightly put off by the external appearance of the building, but once inside it is absolutely lovely. Check in was very quick with a very polite and friendly receptionist and our ground floor room, although through quite a maze of corridors, was large, clean, comfortable and air conditioned, with a very decent sized bathroom and plenty of towels. We were impressed by the pillow ordering service which meant we both were totally comfortable, my husband phoned down for pillows and within 5 minutes they were delivered to the room. The bed itself was very comfortable. When my husband realised he had forgotten to bring a razor and shaving cream he phoned reception who were very quick to bring this to the room. The breakfast choice was extensive, hot and tasty, the restaurant staff were very friendly and efficient. We also used the pool facilities and the staff there were also friendly, the pool itself isn't particuarly big and on the shallow side but well heated and considering how inexpensive the trip was, it was impressive to have such facilities! We didn't eat dinner in the restaurant either night so can't comment on that, but it was easy enough to find other places to eat - central Chester is very near by as is the leisure park adjacent to the Cheshire Oaks retail village which has several restaurants to choose from. Check out was also quick and efficient, again the staff were friendly and we left with a very good impression - we would definitely return.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value and Excellent Facilities

reviews.text: The only slight criticism, which has been made in other reviews here, is that on the second night our sleep was interrupted by some newly arrived Chinese or Japanese tourists who were very noisy, but that is not actually the fault of the hotel.
reviews.title: A real letdown for our family

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel provided an excellent base for exploring, fantastic value for money and impressive facilities given the low cost.
reviews.title: Enjoyable to start...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a family room through the Chester Zoo. The hotel was supposedly refurbished, but it turned out that that will happen next year. Far from Chester itself, along the motorway in an industrial business district.
reviews.title: Fantastic bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Miles of corridors from the reception before we found the " family room" which seemed cramped. The " swimming pool" was full of matrons having an exercise class, which of course put off the grandkids who after a day's travel wanted to swim.
reviews.title: second time ive stayed..still good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we played 35 pounds only for 1 night B&B, cant argue. its clear and a good breakfast and not a far drive from the centre of chester.
reviews.title: cheap and cheerfull

reviews.text: I must commend the Staff at this hotel, they were very professional, friendly and helpful. The Service throughout each department was excellent. The Restaurant had excellent food and was great value for money. The Leisure Centre and Pool were very inviting. Even though the hotel is 3 miles out of the town centre it was easily accessible by bus or taxi. We look forward to returning again.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Excellent Service

reviews.text: Well Done, Holiday Inn Chester South.
reviews.title: Past it's best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff and the food could not be faulted but they were seriously let down by the state of many of the rooms. In our room, and in several others, the wash basin could not be used as the plug system would not stay closed. Tiles were coming loose on the walls of the bathroom and the mastic filler round the bath looked as if it had been re-applied by a chimp on work experience from Chester Zoo! The kettle for the tea/coffee was broken. Our "double" bed was actually two singles pushed together and the sheets and duvet were too small and did not even reach the edges of the bed(s), let alone go over them! Suggest avoiding this place until it has been refurbished.
reviews.title: Good Hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed on night at this hotel, b&b- got a good deal at £17 each for a saturday night.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff and great value.

description: Following a recent 1 million refurbishment the Junction Restaurant and Terrace Bar are now contemporary style. All public areas and bedrooms have full air-conditioning and Wi-Fi access has been installed. The hotel is non smoking. The Holiday Inn Chester South is ideally situated on the edge of the Roman City of Chester, located just off the A55 adjacent to Chester Business Park. This Chester hotel offers 143 bedrooms, all with Wi-Fi access. In an excellent location for both business and leisure visitors alike. Benefiting from immediate proximity to Chester and its attractions including Chester Races, Grosvenor Museum, Cathedral, Chester Zoo, Cheshire Oaks Outlet Village and Blue Planet Aquarium Holiday Inn Chester South provides an ideal visitor base, with a choice of accommodation including Standard, Executive and Accessible bedrooms.The Holiday Inn Chester South combines an excellent range of facilities for both Business and Leisure travellers including Kids Stay & Eat Free*. The hotel has a fully air conditioned gym, 15m heated swimming pool, sauna and jacuzzi. Restaurant and Bar serving food and drink throughout the day and 24 hour room service. *Terms & Conditions apply. Please note that the hotel does not have a lift and the Restaurant, Function Suite and meeting rooms are allocated on the 1st floor.For accessible room contact the hotel direct.
